http.title: White Plains, NY - Official Website | Official Website
http.html:
Skip to Main Content

Create an Account - Increase your productivity, customize your experience, and engage in information you care about.   

  • Sign In
  1. City Government
  2. City Departments
  3. Our Community
  4. Doing Business
  5. How Do I…?

Online Payments
Applications & Permits
Agendas & Minutes
White Plains Multimedia
Stay Notified
Contact Us

Latest News

  1. 2019 Summer Employment Applications Will Be Available Online April 15, 2019 at 5PM

    Open to White Plains residents, only (14-21 years old) - the White Plains Youth Bureau-Youth Employment Services, 2019 Summer Employment Applications will be available online on April 15 beginning at 5pm. Application deadline: 5/31/19 at 5pm. Additional Info...

  2. City of White Plains APRIL E-Newsletter

    April is National Volunteer Month and we're highlighting not-for-profit, community organizations right here in our city that contribute to making White Plains a great place to live. Additional Info...

  3. Social Security Admin Warns Public About Caller ID “Spoofing” Scheme

    The Social Security Administration is working to raise awareness and warn the public about the recent surge in Social Security phone scamming. Read on...

  4. Plainsmen Ice Hockey Travel Program Try-Outs, April 9 - 11th

    The City of White Plains Recreation and Parks Department announces Plainsmen Ice Hockey travel program try-out dates. The Plainsmen Ice Hockey program is a member of the Hudson Valley Hockey League and competes in the tri-state area. Read on...

  5. Proposed 2019-20 City Budget & Schedule of Budget Meetings

    The City of White Plains Proposed 2019-20 Tax Budget has been submitted to the Common Council. Read on for links to the document and to the schedule of public budget meetings and hearing. Read on...

  6. HUD CDBG 2019-20 Annual Action Plan

    The City of White Plains Community Development Draft 2019-20 Annual Action Plan will be available for a 30 day public review period beginning March 29, 2019. The proposed plan will be available at www.whiteplainsny.gov & city facilities. Read on...

  7. Downtown White Plains Wing Walk Saturday, April 6 * Noon – 5:00 PM

    On April 6th there will be a little friendly competition in downtown White Plains as the chicken wing-eating public gets to decide which restaurant has the best wings in the city. To view the White Plains Wing Walk Map & buy tickets -wpbid.com/wingwalk Read on...

  8. The Mobile Shredder is Coming to White Plains, Saturday, March 23rd

    Now you can safely destroy unwanted personal papers and documents - Saturday, March 23rd from 10 AM - 1PM at the Gedney Way Recycling Center. Each resident may bring a maximum of 4 file boxes. All paper must be free of clips, bindings, folders and files Read on...

  9. Sports Night for Youth at White Plains Library, March 19th

    Hear local sports heroes share their stories of how sports brings out the best in us. All youth, ages 8 through18 years old, are invited to attend a special Sports Night at White Plains Library on Tuesday, March 19th from 6:00 – 8:30 p.m. Free event. Read on...

  10. City Spring/Summer Guide to Services Has Arrived!

    The City of White Plains Guide to Programs and Services has been mailed to all residents. Online and in-person program registration begins Monday, March 11, 2019. This Guide contains everything you need to know about programs, events and city amenities. Read on...

  11. 22nd Annual White Plains St. Patrick's Day Parade - Saturday, March 9th at Noon

    Celebrate the 22nd Annual St. Patrick's Day Parade when White Plains and the greater Irish Community come together to celebrate everything Irish. Stay and visit the numerous restaurants and bars serving up Irish music, fun and cheer. Read on...

  12. 52 North Broadway

    The soil test result presentation to the Common Council is being postponed until April. In addition, it is anticipated that the 52 North Broadway DEIS hearing will also be adjourned until April.

  13. City of White Plains MARCH E-Newsletter

    Marching, Munching, and More this month in White Plains! Additional Info...

  14. White Plains Housing Authority Revitalization

    The White Plains Housing Authority has quietly embarked on a major revitalization of its housing assets and has been working to upgrade and transform the face of public housing in White Plains. This program has been implemented with the city's support. Read on...

  15. Expansion of Affordable Rental Housing Program Proposed

    White Plains Mayor Tom Roach today announced a proposal to expand the City’s Affordable Rental Housing Program. When implemented, the program would be the most progressive in Westchester County. Read on...

  16. St. Patrick's Day Luncheon at White Plains Community Center, Thurs, March 14th

    White Plains senior citizens are invited to the Community Center Cafe to celebrate St. Patrick’s Day with a delicious lunch and live entertainment on Thurs., March 14, 2019 (Please Note: NEW DATE) from 11:30 to 1:30 p.m. Read on...

  17. Annual Youth Bureau Performing Arts Benefit, Sat., March 2nd

    Broadway Star Kissy Simmons headline Annual Youth Bureau Performing Arts Benefit. Saturday, March 2nd 7PM at the White Plains Performing Arts Center This Year’s Benefit to Focus on the Theme of Social Justice. Tickets $25 and $50. Call 914.422.1378. Read on...

  18. Police Officer Application

    The City of White Plains is actively seeking diverse candidates for the November 23rd Police Officer exam. Read on...

  19. White Plains Theater Lovers' Club

    Do you like Broadway shows? If so, the White Plains Theater Lovers’ Club is for you! This fun club will meet on Thursday, March 7th at 1:00 p.m. at the White Plains Community Center, located at 65 Mitchell Place. Read on...

  20. White Plains Recreation & Parks Black History Month Special Events

    Join the White Plains Recreation & Parks Department as they celebrate Black History Month with two creative special events at the White Plains Recreation & Parks Community Center, 65 Mitchell Place, White Plains. Read on...

  21. Updated 2/12, 8:45 am: Weather Related Information for White Plains Residents

    All Department of Recreation & Parks and Youth Bureau programs and activities are canceled for Tuesday, February 12, 2019 due to inclement weather. The Library is closed today in observance of Lincoln's birthday. Garbage pick up is on as scheduled. Read on...

  22. WP Youth Bureau & My Brother's Keepers, Celebrate the Annual Achievement Awards, Sat. March 9th

    The White Plains Youth Bureau, the Beta Alpha Alpha Chapter of Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc., and the White Plains My Brother’s Keeper, Present the Annual Achievement Awards Ceremony -Sat. March 9th at 12PM at Highlands Middle School. Read on...

  23. GO GREEN WHITE PLAINS

    We all have them. An old pair of shoes (or two or three) lying on the floor somewhere in the back of our closets, getting dustier by the week. Drop off your gently used shoes at Gedney Recycling Facility located at 87 Gedney Way, White Plains. Read on...

  24. WPETC - Exciting Opportunities Await

    Join us for a Meet & Greet, Tuesday, Feb. 26, 6pm - 8pm at the White Plains Housing Auth. Community Room, 223 MLK, Jr. Blvd. Learn about upcoming OSHA 30 classes and exciting opportunities awaiting at Brookfield Commons Phase II. RSVP 914.686,7102 Read on...

  25. White Plains Recreation & Parks Day Camp Fair - Sat., February 2

    Come to the White Plains Recreation & Parks Camp Fair, Saturday, Feb 2nd, 10 AM – 1PM, at the White Plains High School B1 Meeting Room (enter North Street) to learn more about our summer offerings. Free event, open to residents and non-residents. Read on...

  26. Important Winter Storm Information for White Plains Residents

    A Winter Weather Advisory has been issued for our area from Sat,1/19 thru Sun, 1/20. The City is offering free parking to residents only in the Lex-Grove E & W (Galleria), Ham-Main, & Chester-Maple Garages from 5 PM Sat, 1/19 thru 8 AM Mon, 1/20 only. Read on...

  27. City of White Plains My Brother's Keeper Open House - Sat. Jan. 26th

    The White Plains My Brother’s Keeper will hold an Open House at Eastview Middle School gymnasium on Saturday, Jan. 26th. Read on...

  28. City of White Plains My Brother's Keeper - Kids & Cops Basketball Classic

    On Wednesday, Jan. 23, White Plains My Brother’s Keeper will hold its 1st “Kids & Cops Basketball Classic” 6:30 p.m. at Ridgeway Alliance Church. Don't miss White Plains Finest vs. youth ready to show off their b-ball skills. Free event. Read on...

  29. 52 North Broadway Soil Testing Results

    Soil testing results for 52 North Broadway (former Good Counsel site) have been completed and are available on the city's website. These test results have been sent to NYS Department of Environmental Conservation, as required, for review and comment. Additional Info...

  30. Smoke Testing of Sanitary Sewer System to Start 1/14

    White Plains will be conducting smoke testing of certain sanitary sewer lines in various neighborhoods. The purpose of smoke testing is to locate problem areas within the overall sewer system. The test identifies the sources of leaks and other problems. Read on...

  31. City of Science Event to be Held in White Plains Feb.2nd

    Walk on water. Blast into orbit. Defy gravity. Explore the wonders of science at the Westchester County Center on Sat, Feb 2nd. See large-scale interactive exhibits, mind-blowing demonstrations & hands-on activities. Free & open to all ages! Read on...

  32. White Plains Education Training Center IT Support Tech Bootcamp

    The White Plains Education & Training Center, Westchester Community College and Per Scholas are pleased to offer the next in-demand course to equip adults successfully enter, or advance in, the field of technology: IT SUPPORT SPECIALIST. Apply today. Read on...

  33. City of White Plains JANUARY E-Newsletter

    Happy New Year, White Plains! May it be fun and safe. Read our January newsletter for useful safety and emergency preparedness tips. Additional Info...

  34. Celebrate New Year's Eve in Downtown White Plains!

    The City and the WP BID are once again preparing to ring in the New Year downtown. This family-friendly event, held at the intersection of Main & Court Streets, includes DJ, live entertainment, crowd countdown and ball drop, fireworks display & confetti. Read on...

  35. WinterFest Entertainment Schedule

    Bring the kids, meet up with friends & enjoy WinterFest's shopping (40+ vendors), dining options, and entertainment. Admission and all entertainment is free. Hours: Wed, Thurs & Sun. 11AM -7PM, Fri & Sat 11AM - 9 PM. Read On for Entertainment Schedule. Read on...

  36. Sign Up for White Plains Rec Alerts

    The City of White Plains is encouraging residents to sign up for Recreation & Parks Dept. alerts ("Rec Alerts") in order to receive information and updates about Rec & Parks Dept. programs and activities, including weather-related schedule changes. Read on...

  37. WinterFest kicks off December 19th on Court Street
